Articles.Title: How women are driving the future of travel
Articles.Summary: Solo female travel is particularly on the rise, with nearly 40% of women travellers planning a solo trip in 2025. 21% of female travellers aged 55 and up prefer solo travel versus travelling with a spouse or children.Google searches for "solo female travel" have increased 1,000% in the past decade. 66% of female travellers mark safety as their top concern; a figure unchanged since 2020.

Articles.Title: Diversity backlash: Is 'masculine energy' coming to the UK?
Articles.Summary: Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) programmes aim to boost workers from diverse backgrounds. Donald Trump ordered the shutdown of all federal DEI initiatives. Walmart, McDonald's, Meta and Amazon ditching or scaling back their diversity policies.

Articles.Title: The snowboarders fighting to bring back ski slopes
Articles.Summary: Sheffield Ski Village in Neepsend closed after it was destroyed by fire in April 2012. Winter sports fans hoping to return to the artificial slopes will premiere their film Revive Sheffield Ski Village on Friday.

Articles.Title: New music festival proposed for city park
Articles.Summary: Far and Beyond, the company behind Download and Creamfields, has asked for permission to hold a three-day music festival at Hylands Park in Chelmsford. A premises licence for the event from Friday, 5 September to Sunday, 7 September has been submitted to the council.

Articles.Title: Sheen hopes to get children talking about homelessness
Articles.Summary: Sheen is launching A Home For Spark The Dragon, which tells the story of a dragon who loses his home. He said he hoped it would help children to start thinking about ways they could make a difference in future.

Articles.Title: Wales' largest theme park shuts down after 40 years
Articles.Summary: Oakwood, in Pembrokeshire, opened in 1987 and almost closed in 2008. A £25m investment rescued the park, which employed up to 200 people. Aspro Parks said this was the first time it had closed a park or attraction.

Articles.Title: It's not a competition! The collaborative video game loved by players
Articles.Summary: Split Fiction is a collaborative experience where two players work together to solve puzzles and beat obstacles. The adventure game has received rave reviews and sold one million copies in 48 hours.

Articles.Title: Striking miners threatened to kidnap my little brother
Articles.Summary: Amanda McKay's father, Ted McKay, represented miners who continued to work during the year-long dispute. She recalled a group gathered outside her bedroom window, shouting that they were going to "kidnap my little brother"Adam Price, now a Senedd Member for Plaid Cymru, was a "precocious" 14 year old during the strike. His father, Rufus was a miner at Betws colliery in the Amman valley.

Articles.Title: Cat joins police patrol after escaping rainy weather
Articles.Summary: Cleo, a Maine Coon, hopped into the Essex Police patrol car in Halstead. Officers said she "made herself right at home" by sharpening her claws. Owner Carly Thomson said Cleo was no stranger to adventure.

Articles.Title: Stock market today: Wall Street edges lower despite solid data on the economy
Articles.Summary: The S&P 500 slipped 0.2% after flipping between gains and losses through the day. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dipped by 11 points, or less than 0.1%.
